text: John Knight "Jock" Reid (1907 - April 22, 1965) was a Canadian curler. He was a member of 1947 Brier Champion team (skipped by Jimmy Welsh), playing as second, representing Manitoba. A member of the Deer Lodge Curling Club in Winnipeg, he was also a three-time provincial champion.http://www.curlmanitoba.org/halloffameinductees#.VQ5aDWTF8Vg He retired in 1958, and died in 1965."Time Out", Winnipeg Free Press, Saturday, April 24, 1965, Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, pg. 59 ==References== Category:Brier champions Category:1907 births Category:1965 deaths Category:Curlers from Manitoba Category:Scottish emigrants to Canada Category:Canadian male curlers
title: Jock Reid
